Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2010 07:21AM elena1 wrote: Hello, My experience sounds very much the same. I had AC before surgery.The path showed thechemo killed off everything but because the nodes were all neg, I really am only sure that the sentinnel was positive.They say they cant tell. They took out 18 nodes some were shriveled but all were totally clear. Now having taxotere and herceptin, the radiation.The best to you..Please stay in touch..Elena

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2010 03:43PM elena1 wrote: Im really confused about staging..I definaltely had some node involvment but they say im hard to stage because I had chemo before surgery. The tumor was 2CM and the sentinal node was affected. The surgeon told me that she took out 12 nodes because they were all shriveled up but the pathology on the  nodes and tumor which was down to 1mm came back with no cancer cells. The chemo REALLY worked well..but it leaves questions. Before surgery they said probably late stage 2 or early 3.. I am also Her2 and Hormone rec +. Also does anyone have any ideahow soon the cancer will show up again, having that Her2 I understand  is very bad..Elena
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2012 10:39AM elena1 wrote: Thank you ladies for your input, I guess maybe im expecting to much to soon..I just turned 62. They took me off Arimidex due to severe depression. The Tamox..is better in that area but has other issues. I was excersing but then I started with a hip issue and had a shot for that..now its the lower back and my knee is also giving me trouble. The Dr. said its very likely due to effects of the chemo. I feel like everytime I try to start a excerise routine something gives out. Its very discouraging because I know how important excerise is. Im going to call my onco today and let him know that my balance is off. I did read an article about Tomox that considered that a severe side effect. It scared me a little...Thanks again ladies the support is wonderful...Elena
Posts.Title: 10 months after chemo and feeling lousy elena1 elena1

Posts.Content: elena1 wrote: I finished my chemo..Adriamycin/taxol/1 year herceptin..32 rad treatments and am on Tamoxofin...I was hoping to feel good by now...Im depressed and always tired , although I didnt have any neuropathy..I kind of lose my balance now and then. I ve had injections in my hip and back..my knee is next..The off balace thing is scaring me and I havent mentioned it to the Dr. yet..its very slight .  I cant believe I still feel lousy and even my hair is awful!! Its so thin and grows sooo slow. Sorry to rant but this board has always been so helpful to make me feel like im not just losing my mind...Elena Dx 3/9/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 10 months after chemo and feeling lousy elena1 elena1

Posts.Content: elena1 wrote: Has anyone had to stop taking Taxol and Taxotere..Its made me have so many side effects..dizzy, fainting,rash,Bad body aches, mouth sores no taste,indegestion and really bad he headaches for days..I dont know what to do..This is worse than AC..its been 6 days and im still sick..Elena Dx 3/9/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
